acute_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Acute
acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 3 from 96 hours LC50=30mg/L of the fish (Goldfish) (CERI/NITE Hazard Assessment Report (2005) and others.).

acute_toxicity_dermal.hazard_statement: May be harmful in contact with skin
acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: Based on the rabbit LD50 (dermal route) of 2,550mg/kg (ACGIH (7th, 2001)).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.hazard_name: Acute toxicity Inhalation: Dusts and mists

acute_toxicity_inhalation_gas.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is "liquid" according to the GHS definition and inhalation of its gas is not expected.

acute_toxicity_inhalation_vapor.rationale: Based on the rat LC50 (4 hours) value of 950ppm, calculated from the testing data of rat LC50 (inhalation of vapour) of 3.1mg/L (8 hours), was lower than 90% of the saturated vapor concentration (6,300ppm) under a saturated vapour pressure of 0.63kPa (25degC) (ICSC, 1999), the substance was considered as "vapour containing substantially no mist" and was classified based on standard values expressed in ppm.

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Based on the rat LD50 (oral route) of 830mg/kg (PATTY (4th, 1999)).

carcinogenicity.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is classified as Category A4 by ACGIH (2001).

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Long-term
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_statement: Harmful to aquatic life with long lasting effects
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Although acute toxicity was Category 3 and the bio-accumulation potential was low (log Kow=0.34(Existing Chemical Safety Inspections Data)), since there was no rapidly degrading (the decomposition by BOD: 37%(Existing Chemical Safety Inspections Data)), it was classified into Category 3.

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Classified into Class 3 (UN Recommendations on the Transport of Dangerous Goods, UN#2219)

explosives.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive properties

flammable_gases.hazard_name: Flammable gases including chemically unstable gases
flammable_gases.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

flammable_liquids.rationale: The flash point is 48degC (c.c.) (ICSC, 1999) which is classified into Category 3. Classified into Class 3 and Packing Group III (UN#2219) (UN Recommendations on the Transport of Dangerous Goods)

flammable_solids.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

gases_under_pressure.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Based on negative data on germ cell multi-generation mutagenicity tests in vivo (dominant lethal tests), the absence of data on germ cell mutagenicity tests in vivo, positive data on somatic cell mutagenicity tests in vivo (chromosome aberration tests), and the absence of data on germ cell genotoxicity tests in vivo, described in CERI-NITE Hazard Assessment No.68 (2005).

oxidizing_gases.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Organic compounds containing oxygen (but not fluorine and chlorine), with the oxygen bound to carbon and hydrogen (but not to other elements)

oxidizing_solids.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

pyrophoric_solids.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

reproductive_toxicity.hazard_statement: Suspected of damaging fertility or the unborn child
reproductive_toxicity.rationale: Based on the description in CERI-NITE Hazard Assessment No.68 (2005): The results of rat reproductive toxicity tests suggest a decrease in male fertility potential and the number of corpus luteum, and an increase in the incidence of abnormal spermatozoa (no description available of the general toxicity).

self_heating_substances.rationale: Test methods applicable to liquid substances are not available

self_reactive_substances.rationale: No data available, though containing unsaturated bonds and a distorted ring structure. Classified into Class 3 (UN Recommendations on the Transport of Dangerous Goods, UN#2219)

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Based on the testing data of animal eye irritation tests (CERI Hazard Data 2001-14 (2002), CERI-NITE Hazard Assessment No.68 (2005), PATTY (4th, 1999)): "severe irritant, with irreversible effects observed."

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Based on the testing data of rabbit skin irritation tests (CERI Hazard Data 2001-14 (2002), CERI-NITE Hazard Assessment No.68 (2005), PATTY (4th, 1999)): "severe or moderate irritant."

skin_sensitizer.hazard_statement: May cause an allergic skin reaction
skin_sensitizer.rationale: Based on data on human health effects (CERI-NITE Hazard Assessment No.68 (2005), PATTY (4th, 1999)).

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: Containing no metals or metalloids (B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At)

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_statement: Cause damage to organs through prolonged or repeated exposure (respiratory system)
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: Based on the evidence from animals including "inflammation of the nasal respiratory/olfactory epithelium," "hyperplasia of the nasal gland, purulent inflammation. of the nasal mucosa, degeneration/hyperplasia of the respiratory epithelium," and  "squamous epithelium metaplasia, pneumonia" (CERI-NITE Hazard Assessment No.68 (2005)). The effects on experimental animals were observed at dosing levels within the guidance value ranges for Category 1 (respiratory organs).

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.classification:
Category 1 (central nervous system, respiratory system, liver, kidney),
Category 3 (narcotic effects)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_statement:
Causes damage to organs (central nervous system, respiratory system, liver, kidney)
May cause drowsiness or dizziness (narcotic effects)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: Based on the evidence from animal studies including "suppression of the central nervous system, severe irritation to the respiratory organs (salvation, dyspnea, etc.)," "gasping respiration caused by irritation, dilation of the stomach caused by aerophagia, turbinate congestion/edema, nasal exudates, hepatic/renal congestion, pulmonary edema" (inhalation exposure), "moderate/severe edema, discoloration (purple), dyspnea and lethargy (observed in deceased subjects)" (dermal exposure) (CERI-NITE Hazard Assessment No.68 (2005)), with respiratory irritation and narcotic effects observed.
